physical_appearance:The clipping is a page from the periodical \u0027The Orient Illustrated Weekly\u0027 published on 30 June 1946. The clipping includes part of an article on the right column of the page. There are two black-and-white advertisements on the right column of the page. The edges of the page are slightly folded.

metadata.title_text: The Orient The Story of The Indian Independence Movement in East Asia
metadata.physical_appearance: The clipping is a page from the periodical 'The Orient Illustrated Weekly' published on 30 June 1946. The clipping includes part of an article on the right column of the page. There are two black-and-white advertisements on the right column of the page. The edges of the page are slightly folded.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: "Prior to the World War II period, Indians in Singapore and Malaya retained strong political, sentimental and economic ties with their home country. Anti-colonial thoughts and actions, inspired by the ""call for freedom"" in India
